protocol.title: Multiplexed scNOMe-seq protocol based on isolated single nuclei

source.description:
Before commencing with nuclei isolation and GpC Methyltransferase step, prepare 384- or 96-well collection plates with digestion mix. This can be prepared the day before and kept in the fridge.
ABCD
1ReagentReaction concentration (based on reaction volume)Volumes for 2 384-well plates (+ 15%) (µL)Volumes for single reaction (µL)
2M-Digestion Buffer (2X)1X883.21
3Proteinase K (1.9%)0.095%88.320.1
4Distilled H2O794.880.9
5Total1766.42

ABCD
1ReagentReaction concentration (based on reaction volume)Volumes for 2 384-well plates (+ 15%) (µL)Volumes for single reaction (µL)
2M-Digestion Buffer (2X)1X883.21
3Proteinase K (1.9%)0.095%88.320.1
4Distilled H2O794.880.9
5Total1766.42
To prepare Proteinase K, add 1.04 mL of Proteinase K Storage Buffer to one tube of Proteinase K (as per Zymo Kit instructions).
Also prepare a large quanity of RSB buffer (10X) before beginning nuclei isolation and treatment. From that, make a 1:10 dilution (i.e., RSB buffer 1X) for use in the experiment.

RSB buffer (10X) recipe:
  • 100mM Tris-Cl, pH 7.4
  • 100mM NaCl
  • 30mM MgCl2
This stock can be stored for up to one year at 4ºC.
Mix enough RSB buffer (1X) for the rest of the nuclei isolation and GpC methylation step (make 5 mL to be safe).
Start with a suspension of single cells. Count cells and use ~5-10M cells for this protocol.
Transfer cells to 15 mL Falcon tube.
Spin for 5 minutes at 500xg at 4°C.
Discard supernatant and wash once with ice cold PBS. Spin for 5 minutes at 500xg at 4°C.
Discard supernatant and resuspend cells in 1 mL ice-cold RSB buffer (1X).
Incubate for 10 minutes at room temperature.
Add 15 µL 1% NP-40 solution (0.015% final concentration) to the cell suspension.

source.body: The NP-40 concentration might need to be adjusted depending on cell type

source.description: Transfer cell suspension to a dounce tissue grinder (2 mL volume) and burst the cells with 15 strokes of the pestle (both A and B work).
Transfer lysed cells to a 1.5 mL eppendorf tube.
Centrifuge cells for 5 minutes at 800xg at 4°C.
Discard the supernatant without disturbing the pellet. Wash with 1 mL 1X RSB buffer (without NP-40).

Incubate in RSB buffer for 30 seconds – 1 minute
-
Centrifuge for 5 minutes at 800xg at 4°C.
Discard supernatant and resuspend in 1X GpC methylase buffer such that there are 1M cells per 75 µL.

source.body: If there are <1M cells, resuspend the pellet in 75 µL

source.description:
Prepare two 1.5 mL eppendorf tubes with the following mixture for incubation:
ABC
1ReagentReaction concentration (based on reaction volume)Amount (µL)
2GpC methylase buffer (10X) (NEB)0.5X7.5
3SAM (32mM) (NEB)320µM1.5
4GpC Methytransferase (4U/µL) (NEB)1.33U/µL50
5Distilled H2O16
6Nuclei75
7total150
After adding 75 µL of nuclei to the final mixtures of the above ingredients, pipette to mix.

ABC
1ReagentReaction concentration (based on reaction volume)Amount (µL)
2GpC methylase buffer (10X) (NEB)0.5X7.5
3SAM (32mM) (NEB)320µM1.5
4GpC Methytransferase (4U/µL) (NEB)1.33U/µL50
5Distilled H2O16
6Nuclei75
7total150
Incubate at 37ºC for 7.5 minutes.
Add a boost of 25 µL GpC Methyltransferase (100U) and 0.75 µL 32mM SAM to the nuclei.
Incubate at 37°C for 7.5 minutes.
Add 500 µL 1X PBS and spin for 5 minutes at 800 g at 4°C.

Remove supernatant and resuspend in 0.5-1 mL 1X PBS.
–
Add 2 drops of Hoechst.

source.body: If the cells are resuspended in <500 µL of 1X PBS, use 1 drop of Hoechst

source.description: Keep on ice for ~15 minutes before FACS sorting.
Add 15 µL CT conversion reagent to each well of 2 384-well plate. Pipette up and down 8 times to mix the sample.

To prepare CT Conversion Reagent add the following buffers to one bottle of CT Conversion Reagent:
  • 7.9 mL M-Solubilization Buffer
  • 3 mL M-Dilution Buffer
  • Once the reagent is fully dissolved through shaking and vortexing vigorously, add:
  • 1.6 mL M-Reaction Buffer
Once the reagent is fully dissolved through shaking and vortexing vigorously, add:
Seal the plates with adhesive film and quick spin for 10s at 2,000xg at room temperature.

Place the plate in a thermocycler and run the following program:
98°C 8 minutes
64°C 3.5hrs
4°C Hold

Prior to cleaning up bisulfite conversion reactions, make Random Primer Solution for each of the 8 primers being used such that each is at a final molarity of 500nM. Keep on ice.
ABCD
1ReagentReaction concentration (based on reaction volume)Volumes for 2 384-well plates (+ 8 extra reactions) (µL)Volumes for single reaction (µL)
2Random primer stock (100µM)500nM3.640.035
3M-Elution Buffer7287
4Total731.647

ABCD
1ReagentReaction concentration (based on reaction volume)Volumes for 2 384-well plates (+ 8 extra reactions) (µL)Volumes for single reaction (µL)
2Random primer stock (100µM)500nM3.640.035
3M-Elution Buffer7287
4Total731.647
Place 2 Zymo-Spin 384-Well DNA Binding Plate on two 2.0 mL 96-Well Deep Well Plates.
Load 80 µL M-Binding Buffer to each well of the Zymo-Spin 384-Well DNA Binding Plates.
Transfer bisulfite conversion reactions to the Zymo-Spin 384-Well DNA Binding Plates. Pipette up and down 8 times to mix the sample.
Centrifuge for 5 minutes at 5,000xg.
Discard the flow through by decanting and add 100 µL M-Wash Buffer to each well of the 384-Well DNA Binding Plates.
Centrifuge for 5 minutes at 5,000xg.
Discard the flow through by decanting and add 50 µL M-Desulphonation Buffer to each well of the 384-Well DNA Binding Plates.
Incubate at room temperature for 15 minutes.
Centrifuge for 5 minutes at 5,000xg.
Discard the flow through by decanting and add 100 µL M-Wash Buffer to each well of the 384-Well DNA Binding Plates.
Centrifuge for 5 minutes at 5,000xg.
Repeat wash steps (38 and 39) once more.
Place the 384-Well DNA Binding Plates on 2 new 384-well PCR plates. Add 7 µL Random Primer Solution to each well of the 384-Well DNA Binding Plates.
Incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.
Centrifuge for 5 minutes at 5,000xg and discard the 384-Well DNA Binding Plate.
Seal the 384-well PCR plate with adhesive film and store at -20°C for up to 1 week.

Prior to denaturing the samples, make Random Priming Master Mix and keep sealed on ice:
ABCD
1ReagentReaction concentration (based on reaction volume)Volumes for 2 384-well plates (+ 10%) (µL)Volumes for single reaction (µL)
2Blue Buffer (10X)1X8451
3Klenow exo (50U/µL)1.25U/µL211.250.25
4dNTP (10mM each)500uM each422.50.5
5Distilled H2O2746.253.25
6Total42255

2Blue Buffer (10X)1X8451
3Klenow exo (50U/µL)1.25U/µL211.250.25
4dNTP (10mM each)500uM each422.50.5

source.body: Reaction volume is 10 µL because it's assumed that 2 µL is lost during the centrifugation in step 43 (Luo et al., 2018)

source.description:
Denature the samples by placing the 384-well PCR plates on a thermocycler and run the following program:
95°C 3 minutes
Immediately place the plate on ice for 2 minutes.
Add 5 µL Random Priming Master Mix to each well of the 384-well PCR plates.
Vortex and quick spin for 10 seconds at 2,000xg.

Place the plates in a thermocycler and run the following program:
4°C 5 minutes
25°C 5 minutes
37°C 60 minutes
4°C Hold

Add 1.5 µL Exo/rSAP Master Mix to each well of the 384-well PCR plates.
ABCD
1ReagentReaction concentration (based on reaction volume)Volumes for 2 384-well plates (+extra) (µL)Volumes for single reaction (µL)
2Exonuclease I (20U/µL)1.74U/µL9221
3rSAP (1U/µL)0.043U/µL4610.5
4Total13831.5

ABCD
1ReagentReaction concentration (based on reaction volume)Volumes for 2 384-well plates (+extra) (µL)Volumes for single reaction (µL)
2Exonuclease I (20U/µL)1.74U/µL9221
3rSAP (1U/µL)0.043U/µL4610.5
4Total13831.5
Vortex to mix the samples and quick spin for 10 seconds at 2,000xg.

Place the plate in a thermocycler and run the following program:
37°C 30 min
4°C Hold
Before to proceeding with sample clean-up, prepare enough SPRI beads (14 mL) for the whole experiment. Store beads at 4°C and always take out 30 minutes prior to use.
Mix Sera-Mag SpeedBeads and transfer 280 µL to a 1.5 mL tube.
Place beads on a magnetic stand until the solution is clear of beads. Carefully remove the supernatant.
Wash twice with 1 mL TE. For each wash, remove the tube from the magnet and mix by inversion.
Resuspend washed beads in 280 µL TE.
Add 2.52 g PEG 8000 to a new 50 mL sterile conical tube.
Add 2.8 mL of 5M NaCl to the 50 mL tube.
Add 140 µL 1M Tris-HCl pH=8.0 and 28 µL of 0.5M EDTA pH=8.0 to the 50 mL tube.

Add 7-8 mL distilled H2O and mix until PEG 8000 dissolves into solution.
–
Add the washed Sera-Mag SpeedBeads to the 50 mL conical tube and vortex before use.
Add enough distilled H2O to bring the total volume up to 14 mL. Mix before each use.
Add 73.6 µL (0.8x) SPRI beads to each well of a clean 96-well PCR plate.

Pool the samples from the 2 384-well PCR plates to one 96-well PCR plate such that each well of the 96-well PCR plate holds a pool of 8 samples, with each of those samples having been indexed with a different distinct random primer during step 40.
(2 rows of each 384-well plate combine in one row of the 96-well plate.)
Vortex and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.
Quick spin for 10 seconds at 2,000xg.
Place the 96-well PCR plate on the DynaMagTM-96 Side Magnet and let stand until the solution in each well is clear of beads (~5 minutes).
Wash beads 3 times with 150 µL fresh 80% EtOH.
Remove all EtOH and let beads dry at room temperature. Do not overdry the beads.
Add 10 µL Elution Buffer (Qiagen) to each well and resuspend beads by pipette.
Vortex and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.
Quick spin for 10 seconds at 2,000xg.
Place back on magnet and let stand until solution is clear (~5 minutes).
Transfer 10 µL of the supernatant from each well to a clean 96-well PCR plate.

Denature the samples by placing 96-well plates on a thermocycler and run the following program:
95°C 3 min
Immediately place the plate on ice for 2 minutes.

Add 10.5 µL Adaptase Master Mix to each well of the 96-well PCR plate. Vortex and quick spin for 10s at 2,000xg.
ABC
1ReagentVolumes for 2 384-well plates (+extra) (µL)Volumes for single reaction (µL)
2Elution Buffer (Qiagen)450.54.25
3Buffer G12122
4Reagent G22122
5Reagent G3132.51.25
6Enzyme G4530.5
7Enzyme G5530.5
8Total111310.5

ABC
1ReagentVolumes for 2 384-well plates (+extra) (µL)Volumes for single reaction (µL)
2Elution Buffer (Qiagen)450.54.25
3Buffer G12122
4Reagent G22122
5Reagent G3132.51.25
6Enzyme G4530.5
7Enzyme G5530.5
8Total111310.5

Place the plate in a thermocycler and run the following program:
37°C 30 min
95°C 2 min
4°C Hold
Add 5 µL PCR Primer Mix to every well.

Dilute each P5L primer such that the final concentration is 600nM (0.6µM) after the two primers corresponding to each well are combined
ABC
1ReagentMix concentration (based on reaction volume)Volume (µL)
2P5L stock (100µM)1.2µM1.2
3Distilled H2O98.8
4Total100

ABC
1ReagentMix concentration (based on reaction volume)Volume (µL)
2P5L stock (100µM)1.2µM1.2
3Distilled H2O98.8
4Total100

Dilute each P7L primer such that the final concentration is 1µM two primers corresponding to each well are combined.
ABC
1ReagentMix concentration (based on reaction volume)Volume (µL)
2P7L stock (100µM)2µM2
3Distilled H2O98
4Total100

ABC
1ReagentMix concentration (based on reaction volume)Volume (µL)
2P7L stock (100µM)2µM2
3Distilled H2O98
4Total100

To a new 96-well PCR plate, add 3 µL of each P5L primer to individual columns and 3 µL of each P7L primer to individual rows (one P5L primer per column, one P7L primer per row). Each well contains the PCR Primer Mix for the corresponding well in the sample plate. (Fig. 1)
Using a multichannel pipette, transfer 5 µL of the primer mix to the sample plate.
Add 25 µL 2X KAPA HiFi Mix to each well.
Vortex and quick spin for 10 seconds at 2,000xg.

Place the plate in a thermocycler and run the following program:
a. 95°C 2 minutes
b. 98°C 30 seconds
c. 98°C 15 seconds
d. 64°C 30 seconds
e. 72°C 2 minutes
Go to step c 14 times (15 cycles total)
f. 72°C 5 minutes
g. 4°C Hold

source.body: Number of cycles can be adjusted

source.description: Add 40 µL (0.8x) SPRI Beads to each well of the 96-well PCR plate containing the sample.
Vortex and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.
Quick spin for 10 seconds at 2,000xg.
Place 96-well plates on DynaMag™-96 Side Magnet, let stand until solution in wells is clear of beads (~5 minutes).
Remove supernatant and wash beads 2 times with 150 µL freshly made 80% EtOH.
Remove all EtOH after the last wash and remove plate from magnet. Let beads dry at room temperature. DO NOT overdry beads.
Add 25 µL Elution Buffer (Qiagen) and resuspend beads by pipette.
Vortex and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.
Quick spin for 10 seconds at 2,000xg.
Place back on magnet and let stand until solution is clear of beads (~5 minutes).
Combine 25 µL eluent from all wells in each column of the 96-well plate (8 wells per column, 12 columns) into 12 1.5 mL Eppendorf tubes.
Add 160 µL (0.8x) SPRI Beads to each 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube. Pipette to mix and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.
Place 1.5 mL tubes on DynaMag™-2 Magnet, let stand until solution in tubes in clear of beads (~5 minutes).
Remove supernatant and wash beads 2 times with 200 µL fresh 80% EtOH.
After the last wash, remove all EtOH and let beads dry at room temperature. DO NOT overdry beads.
Add 40 µL Elution Buffer (Qiagen) and resuspend beads by pipet. Incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.
Place tubes back on magnet and let stand until solution is clear of beads (~5 minutes).
Remove 40 µL supernatant to 12 clean 1.5 mL Eppendorf tubes.
Measure concentration of each 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube with Qubit dsDNA BR Assay Kit.

materials.name: Proteinase K w/ storage buffer set

description:
What follows is the protocol for performing single-cell Nucleosome Occupancy and Methylome sequencing on single nuclei (scNOMe-seq). This plate-based method, which can be used to simultaneously assess nucleosome occupancy and DNA methylation in single nuclei, draws upon the approach laid out in Luo et al., 2018. Everything from the initial nuclei sorting step to the final library preparation that directly precedes sequencing is included in this protocol. This protocol is optimized for non-neuronal nuclei and can be applied to a range of different cell types (e.g., intestinal organoid, fibroblasts).
This is the method we are using and it is working.
Adapted from "Robust single-cell DNA methylome profiling with snmC-seq2," by C. Luo et al., 2018, Nature Communications 9(1), pp. 1-6. Copyright 2018 by the authors.
